org.wiredwidgets.cow.server.web

Class TasksController

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.wiredwidgets.cow.server.web.CowServerController
      • org.wiredwidgets.cow.server.web.TasksController

  • @Controller
@RequestMapping(value="/tasks")
public class TasksController
extends CowServerController
    Handles REST API methods for the /tasks resource
    Author:
    JKRANES

public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Task> getTask(@PathVariable(value="id")
                                                                                long id)
        Retrieve a single task by its ID
        Parameters:
        id - the task ID
        Returns:
        the Task object

      • completeTask

        @RequestMapping(value="/{id}",
                method=DELETE)
@ResponseBody
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> completeTask(@PathVariable(value="id")
                                                                                  long id,
                                                                                  @RequestParam(value="outcome",required=false)
                                                                                  String outcome,
                                                                                  @RequestParam(value="var",required=false)
                                                                                  String[] variables)
        Mark a task as complete The choice of DELETE here is based on the fact that this action causes the resource (i.e. task) to be removed from its location at the specified URL. Once completed, the task will then appear under the /tasks/history URI. Response: http 204 if success, 404 if the task was not found (i.e. an invalid task ID or a task that was already completed), http 409 if task hasn't been assigned to a user yet
        Parameters:
        id - the task ID
        outcome - the outgoing transition for the completed task. Required if the task has more than one possible outcome.
        variables - variable assignments for the completed task, in name:value format. More than one instance of this parameter can be provided (e.g. ?variable=name1:value1&variable=name2:value2 etc)

      • takeTask

        @RequestMapping(value="/{id}/take",
                method=POST,
                params="assignee")
@ResponseBody
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Task> takeTask(@PathVariable(value="id")
                                                                                 long id,
                                                                                 @RequestParam(value="assignee")
                                                                                 String assignee)
        Assign a task to a user.
        Parameters:
        id -
        assignee -
        Returns:
        404 if no task with id, 403 if assignee is not allowed to take the task

      • getUnassignedTasksByCandidate

        @RequestMapping(value="",
                params="candidate",
                method=GET)
@ResponseBody
public Tasks getUnassignedTasksByCandidate(@RequestParam(value="candidate")
                                                              String candidate)
        Retrieve all active unassigned tasks for which a user is an eligible candidate. This includes both tasks for which the user is directly a candidate, via the candidateUser element in the process XML, or indirectly, via the user's membership in a group, as indicated by a candidateGroup element.
        Parameters:
        candidate - the user ID
        Returns:
        a Tasks object

      • getTasksByProcessInstance

                params="processInstance",

@ResponseBody

                                                          long processInstanceId)
        Retrieve all active tasks for the specified process instance ID
        Parameters:
        processInstance - the processInstance ID
        Returns:
        a Tasks object

      • getHistoryTask

        @RequestMapping(value="/history/{id}")
@ResponseBody
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<HistoryTask> getHistoryTask(@PathVariable(value="id")
                                                                                              long id)
        Retrieve a single HistoryTask by its ID. Note that the intent use of this method is to retrieve completed tasks, therefore the behavior in the case of providing the ID of an active task should be considered to be 'undefined'.
        Parameters:
        the - task ID
        Returns:
        a HistoryTask object as XML

      • getHistoryTasks

        @RequestMapping(value="/history",
                method=GET,
                params="!process")
@ResponseBody
public HistoryTasks getHistoryTasks(@RequestParam(value="assignee",required=false)
                                                       String assignee,
                                                       @RequestParam(value="start",required=false)
                                                       Date start,
                                                       @RequestParam(value="end",required=false)
                                                       Date end)
        Retrieves a set of HistoryTasks selected by various criteria. Parameters are optional and will be applied if provided to narrow the set of tasks returned. This method will retrieve completed tasks only. Note: HistoryTasks and HistoryActivities are very similar, a key distinction being that HistoryTasks includes ad-hoc tasks. If ad-hoc tasks are not needed, in some cases HistoryActivities may be more useful.
        Parameters:
        assignee - the task assignee at the time of completion
        start - start date as YYYY-MM-DD
        end - end date as YYYY-MM-DD
        Returns:
        a HistoryTasks object as XML
        See Also:
        ProcessInstancesController#getProcessInstanceActivities(java.lang.String, java.lang.String, javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse)

        @Deprecated
@RequestMapping(method=POST)

public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Task> createTask(@RequestBody
                                                                                              Task task,
                                                                                              org.springframework.web.util.UriComponentsBuilder uriBuilder)
        Deprecated. AFAIK no one uses this
        Create a new ad-hoc task, i.e. one not associated with any process instance Note: ad-hoc tasks are considered experimental and may not function as expected in all cases. The HTTP response Location header provides the URL of the new task.
        Parameters:
        task - a task object in XML sent as the request body
        task -
        uriBuilder -
